metadata.Title: CVE-2011-2830 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before 14.0.835.163, does not properly implement script object wrappers, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-2830` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 15.0.874.106~r107270-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 15.0.874.106~r107270-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 15.0.874.106~r107270-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 15.0.874.106~r107270-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 15.0.874.106~r107270-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '15.0.874.106~r107270-0ubuntu1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
